respStmt.orgName: Correspondence of Ferdinand von Mueller Project

respStmt.resp: Converted from Microsoft Word to TEI P5

msIdentifier.msName: RB MSS M1, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

encodingDesc.p: The file data/letters/1880-9/1884/84-00-00f-final.doc was converted from Microsoft Word format into TEI using an XProc pipeline.

div.p: RB MSS M1, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

The collecting numbers given are used more than once, for different species, often within a year. The pattern of collecting numbers does not allow the year that this list was sent to be definitively deduced. It is dated to 1884 as the earliest that it could have been sent; 1887 also appears to be possible. It also appears that not all specimens have been retained in MEL: collecting number 2 is recorded only once, for a collection dated to 1890. Description of plants &c sent

cell.p: Hab Table land, I have noticed that this plant in summer follows the Suns course, in the forenoon North & N East, in afternoon North & North West

cell.style: padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;
padding-left: 0.0556in; padding-right: 0.0556in; padding-top: 0in; padding-bottom: 0in; border: none;

cell.p:
Is a troublesome weed covering the ground to the excusion
exclusion? of grass Hab, New England

cell.p: Hab Falls, flowers in winter Seeds when ripe, hard colour red hanging from the plant by a thred an inch long

cell.p: grows on E Slopes, will soon be exterminated by the cattle, if not sufficiently distinct let me know and I will search for another specimen
